required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Impact of an Oral Health Intervention
clinical_study.official_title: Impact of an Oral Health Intervention Among a Group of Patients With Eating Disorders (Anorexia Nervosa and Bulimia Nervosa)

lead_sponsor.agency: University of North Carolina, Chapel Hill

clinical_study.source: University of North Carolina, Chapel Hill

brief_summary.textblock: This pilot study will assess the effectiveness of an original oral health education program on affecting the behaviors of patients diagnosed with eating disorders.

primary_outcome.measure: Percent Change of Participants Able to Correctly Identify Possible Oral Effects of Eating Disorders
primary_outcome.description: A multiple choice survey inquiring about potential effects of eating disorders (e.g., Tooth erosion, Probable erosion sites, Tooth sensitivity, Dry mouth, Enlarged saliva glands, Oral cancer, or No pain) and Positive Self-Perception (e.g., Confidence, Appearance, Kissing, General Health Attendance) posed as Yes/No response.

arm_group.description: Outpatients and inpatients from UNC Center of Excellence for Eating Disorders clinic

intervention.intervention_name: Smiles Matter Oral Health Education Series
intervention.description: Three sessions scheduled 2 weeks apart consisting of 15-20 minutes of didactic learning, 10 minutes of a group/personal exercise, and 10 minutes of questions that the patients have on the topic discussed that day

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Patient of the UNC Center for Excellence for Eating Disorders inpatient unit or outpatient clinic.
- Diagnosis of anorexia nervosa or bulimia nervosa
- Aged 13-50 years
- English-speaking
Exclusion Criteria:
- Decisionally impaired (i.e., Incapable of providing informed consent in the opinion of the primary care provider in UNC Center for Excellence for Eating Disorders)
- Involuntarily committed to the inpatient service of the UNC Department of Psychiatry

overall_official.affiliation: University of North Carolina, Chapel Hill

facility.name: UNC Center of Excellence for Eating Disorders Clinic

patient_data.ipd_description: Deidentified individual data that supports the results will be shared.
patient_data.ipd_access_criteria: The investigator who proposes to use the data has approval from an Institutional Review Board (IRB), Independent Ethics Committee (IEC), or Research Ethics Board (REB), as applicable, and executes a data use/sharing agreement with UNC.
